meanings.definition: To stir or agitate (a liquid) vigorously
meanings.sent1: She used a big spoon to churn the soup.
meanings.sent2: The storm caused the ocean to churn violently.
meanings.sent3: The kids took turns to churn the milk for fun.
meanings.sent4: Emotions churned inside her like a turbulent sea.
meanings.sent5: The blender started to churn the ingredients into a smooth paste.

meanings.definition: To produce something in an abundant and continuous manner
meanings.sent1: The factory can churn out hundreds of toys every day.
meanings.sent2: The bakery churns fresh bread daily.
meanings.sent3: The writer could churn out stories effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The machine churned out paper at a rapid pace.
meanings.sent5: The artist's mind seemed to churn out ideas endlessly.

meanings.definition: A container or machine used to make butter
meanings.sent1: She used the old wooden churn to make butter.
meanings.sent2: The churn was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The antique churn added a rustic charm to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The churn had intricate carvings on its surface.
meanings.sent5: The churn had a smooth handle for easy operation.

meanings.definition: The act of churning or being churned
meanings.sent1: The churn of the waves against the rocks was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The churn of events left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent3: The sudden churn of emotions caught her off guard.
meanings.sent4: The market experienced a churn in prices due to the new regulations.
meanings.sent5: The constant churn of thoughts kept him awake at night.
